root.#: Event: MC gets an investigation request, but upon arriving in an undisclosed warehouse, they discover it is a trap. They are attacked, and a fight commences. MC uses magic, but discovers power weakening. Uses remaining magic to call for Ariar, and the friend saves you.

root: ^Opens with the MC walking down the street, navigating their way to the address that is written on the letter.
^123 I-Don't-Want-to-be-here-Street. Yeah, this is the place. Nobody around, what could be here that needs my help? This place couldn't be helped by House Holly on a good day.
^The MC's phone begins to ring, and as they pick it up, they hear the voice of Ariar on the other end.
^Hey did you get to the place? Find anything yet?
^Yeah, I found the place easy enough. Big warehouse, though looks as empty as the street that I had to take to get here. Find anything interesting about it with your research?
^Nothing yet. Built a few decades back, and hasn't seen commercial use in at least a few years. Now it's only used by the local kids and strays.
^If this is another stolen cat I am going to explode.
^Don't worry, I checked the Zodiac board (Fantasy Facebook) first thing after you left. Nobody has posted about missing pets recently. At least, nowhere around here.
^Well, I suppose that's a relief. Still leaves the question of why that letter came in. Stay on the line, I'm going to check out the inside.
^Sure, keep me posted on any updates.
^The MC moves into the interior of the warehouse, holding the phone just a breadth away from their face.
^Nothing here, I think we just got a prank call out here.

^As the MC lowers the phone to end the call, they are suddenly interrupted by a bolt of arcane energy streaking out from the rafters, striking their phone and sending it careening towards a wall, where it impacts with a resounding crunch.
^A hooded figure, the Assassin, drops from their vantage point on the ceiling, landing on the floor like a fart on the wind. Silent, but deadly.
^You are a selfless fool, yet I envy your audacity.
^What are you talking about? How dare you attack an investigator.

^You know the inevitability of a house war. Yet despite this knowledge you have chosen not to aid, but to stay away. You allow the world to crumble, the houses to be destroyed, then you are in charge of the world. No damage comes to you, yet the rest of us have to die. It is not right that the rest of us die in your absence. That's why you have to die instead.
^In tnamehat case, I'll grant you a premature death.
^A fight ensues. Play continues for a few rounds.
^They're strong. I'll have to use a Magic Attack.
^MC uses a Magic Attack. It is weaker than normal.
^That's... strange. My magic seems weaker now. I'm so, tired. Perhaps I have just enough magic energy to call for Ariar.
^MC is prompted to use Magic Call to summon Ariar. Ariar responds, guaranteeing arrival shortly.
^Now I just have to hold out until he gets here.
^The fight continues. Player's cannot use magic, but can use Attack, Defend, and Inspect. Eventually, Ariar arrives. He blasts the Assassin with a magic attack. The Assassin is knocked unconscious.
^Barely. I don't know what would have happened if you arrived a moment later.
^If my timing wasn't impeccable, I wouldn't have a job.
^No, Ariar. If your timing wasn't impeccable, I wouldn't have a life.
^Well, if it wasn't for your magic call, I would have never found you.
^I am truly glad you did, my friend.
^I'm fine... I think. I just need some rest.
^I understand, friend. You have done a lot today. You should go home and rest. I will take care of things here.
^Thank you, Ariar. You are a good man.
^MC walks away, heading home. En route, they reflect on the strange happenings they had experienced, musing to nobody in particular.
^That was... strange. My magic felt like it was fading. Even trying to make that call took everything out of me. Perhaps I have overworked myself, after all.
